intro: Sida repens, commonly known as prostrate sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is a low-growing, herbaceous annual that typically spreads along the ground, forming a dense mat. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical in shape, with a hairy texture, and it is often found in disturbed soils and arid environments. Sida repens is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas.
